posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
It’s come to my attention that there’s a regression in our binding software that have broken support for the CTRE libraries at this time. I’ll take a look tonight, but I don’t have an estimate for a fix at this time.

For more information see:

https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-ctre/issues/142

https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-build/pull/156

And if you happen to be a C++ expert who has experience with pybind11, I welcome your input

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
Status update: I’ve root caused the issue to a pybind11 regression (investigation details in PR linked below). No idea how to fix it yet, but will think about it. If you’re awesome at C++, you can fix it for me!

[smart_holder] Add tests demonstrating smart_holder issues with multiple inheritance pybind:smart_holder ← robotpy:smart-holder-mvi opened 08:52AM - 21 Jan 22 UTC virtuald +194 -0

[smart_holder] Add tests demonstrating smart_holder issues with multiple inheritance pybind:smart_holder ← robotpy:smart-holder-mvi opened 08:52AM - 21 Jan 22 UTC virtuald +194 -0

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
This will be fixed in 2022.0.4.

I might need to rebuild the entire RobotPy release for this update, but I don’t have time to do that tonight… but my minimal testing indicates that it might just work as is, so I’m going to push a new robotpy-ctre release tonight. Please let me know if you run into further crashes!

posts.name: Shivam Aarya
posts.cooked:
I don’t know if I’m doing something wrong, but should the segmentation fault be fixed if robotpy-ctre is updated to 2022.0.4? We updated ctre to 2022.0.4, but we still get the same error: image 2082×942 99.8 KB

image 2082×942 99.8 KB

image 2082×942 99.8 KB

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: Well, in theory it should have been fixed. Post your code?

posts.name: Shivam Aarya
posts.cooked: Sure! As of right now, we have a simple robot set up to test our drivetrain with a bare-bones script just to see if it works: https://github.com/Shavem/TestBot/blob/master/py/robot/robot.py

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: It appears that some things work but some things are still broken. I’ll add more tests.

posts.name: Shivam Aarya
posts.cooked: Sounds good, I’ll keep tabs on the GitHub issue. Thank you so much for your time and effort!

posts.name: steve rinard
posts.cooked:
We no longer get the segmentation fault. Our code had some other errors that were fixed and we now have a bare chassis with 4 talonfx motors and an xbox controller that is running correctly.

Github link:

main/Sidius

This is where we will keep our code. Contribute to SteelRidgeRobotics/2021-2022_FRC_Season development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: I made some fixes and tried them locally, but I think I need to rebuild all of RobotPy. Will try that later.

posts.name: Shivam Aarya
posts.cooked:
Yeah, we do get a different error now but it still doesn’t work for us: image 2319×1115 295 KB

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: I’ve got a bunch of rebuilds in the queue tonight, they should finish in an hour or so. Once robotpy-ctre 2022.0.5 comes out, I think that will resolve many of the issues.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
